channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Direct current generation in triboelectric nanogenerators through ionic dynamics and electrode polarization effects
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 29 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64582-w

The authors demonstrate that incorporating plasticizers into polyvinyl chloride enables rectifier-less triboelectric nanogenerators with stable direct current output in contact-separation, sliding, and rotary motions, with electrode polarization playing a crucial role in the process.
item.dc:title: Direct current generation in triboelectric nanogenerators through ionic dynamics and electrode polarization effects
item.dc:creator: Gerald Selasie Gbadam
Hyosik Park
Cheoljae Lee
Hyeonseo Joo
Sujeong Gwak
Hong-Joon Yoon
Hanjun Ryu
Sang Min Lee
Ju Hun Lee
Ju-Hyuck Lee

item.title: Unveiling multifunctional synthetic boundaries for enhanced mechanical and electrochemical performance in densified thick composite electrodes
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 29 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65257-2

Thick electrodes can increase the energy density of lithium-ion batteries but often face charge transport limits and degradation. Here, authors develop thick, dense electrodes with synthetic boundaries, improving mechanical robustness and specific, areal, and volumetric capacities as high as 497 mAh cm−3.
item.dc:title: Unveiling multifunctional synthetic boundaries for enhanced mechanical and electrochemical performance in densified thick composite electrodes
item.dc:creator: Bo Nie
Seok Woo Lee
Ta-Wei Wang
Tengxiao Liu
Ju Li
Hongtao Sun

item.title: Rattle drum-inspired triboelectric nanogenerator with enhanced output using charge dispatch and magnetic repulsion pendulum
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 29 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64575-9

The study develops a rattle drum-inspired triboelectric nanogenerator with a charge dispatch strategy and structural design to enhance output. It achieves a triboelectric surface density of 2.76 cm-1. Field tests show effective wave energy harvesting using a magnetic repulsion pendulum.
item.dc:title: Rattle drum-inspired triboelectric nanogenerator with enhanced output using charge dispatch and magnetic repulsion pendulum
item.dc:creator: Wei Tang
Hongfang Li
Jiawei Li
Weiyu Zhou
Jiaqi Duan
Yongsheng Wen
Lingyu Wan
Guanlin Liu
